## PDE Visualization Framework

A comprehensive tool for solving and visualizing Partial Differential Equations with real-time 3D rendering.

**Try it out:** [Live Web App](https://math-viz.streamlit.app){target="_blank"}

**GitHub Repository:** [View on GitHub](https://github.com/NoahWotschke/Math-Viz){target="_blank"}

### Overview

Math-Viz provides an intuitive interface for exploring complex mathematical concepts through interactive 3D visualization.

#### Supported PDEs

```{mermaid}
graph TD
    PDE["PDE Classification"]
    
    PDE --> HEAT["Heat Equation<br/><i>Parabolic / Time-Dependent</i>"]
    PDE --> LAPLACE["Laplace Equation<br/><i>Elliptic / Steady-State</i>"]
    PDE --> POISSON["âš¡ Poisson Equation<br/><i>Elliptic / Steady-State</i>"]
    PDE --> WAVE["Wave Equation<br/><i>Hyperbolic / Time-Dependent</i>"]
    
    HEAT --> HEAT_FD["Finite Domain<br/>Bounded"]
    HEAT --> HEAT_ID["Infinite Domain<br/>Unbounded"]
    HEAT_ID --> HEAT_FT["Fourier Transform"]
    HEAT_ID --> HEAT_HK["Heat Kernel"]
    
    LAPLACE --> LAP_CART["Cartesian Rectangle"]
    LAPLACE --> LAP_POLAR["Polar Disk"]
    LAP_CART --> LAP_CART_D["Dirichlet"]
    LAP_CART --> LAP_CART_N["Neumann"]
    LAP_POLAR --> LAP_POLAR_D["Dirichlet"]
    LAP_POLAR --> LAP_POLAR_N["Neumann"]
    
    POISSON --> POISSON_D["Dirichlet"]

    WAVE --> WAVE_FD["Finite Domain<br/>Standing Waves"]
    WAVE --> WAVE_ID["Infinite Domain<br/>Traveling Waves"]

    style PDE fill:#1f407a,color:#fff
    style HEAT fill:#ff6b6b,color:#fff
```

### Features

- Real-time 3D rendering
- PDE solving capabilities
- Interactive parameter adjustment
- Export functionality
